meanings.definition: To make or become dry and thirsty
meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the sun all day, I felt my throat parching for a drink.
meanings.sent2: The desert heat can quickly leave you parching for water.
meanings.sent3: As the hiker continued on the trail, his water bottle started parching for attention.
meanings.sent4: The intense summer sun seemed to be parching the very earth itself.
meanings.sent5: The image of the withered plants in the dry soil left a vivid picture of parching in my mind.

meanings.definition: To dry or shrivel with heat
meanings.sent1: The laundry hanging outside was parching in the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: The grapes on the vine began parching under the relentless summer sun.
meanings.sent3: The poor snowman was slowly parching away in the warm winter sun.
meanings.sent4: The old parchment parching in the attic seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The once lush garden was now parching under the unrelenting heat of summer.

meanings.definition: To roast or dry with intense heat
meanings.sent1: The chef was parching the coffee beans to perfection in the roaster.
meanings.sent2: The campfire was parching the marshmallows to a golden brown.
meanings.sent3: The sun seemed to be parching the beachgoers, turning them into human raisins.
meanings.sent4: The blacksmith was parching the metal in the forge to shape it into a sword.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat of the oven was parching the bread, filling the kitchen with a delightful aroma.
